questions.question: 1. An unknown molecule A has 4 signals in the 1H NMR spectrum. Which of the following corresponds to molecule A?

answers.a: It has only one type of proton.
answers.b: It has only two types of protons.
answers.c: It has four types of protons.
answers.d: It has six types of proton.

explanations.c: Number of signals correspond to the number of types of protons in the molecule.

questions.question: 2. What is the splitting pattern of the methylene protons in propane?

explanations.a: The splitting pattern depends on the number of protons on the neighbouring atom (n) using the formula (n+1). Methylene protons in propane belongs to CH&#8322 group in the middle which has 3 H atoms each on the neighbouring atoms. For triplet, n would be 2.
explanations.b: The splitting pattern depends on the number of protons on the neighbouring atom (n) using the formula (n+1). Methylene protons in propane belongs to CH&#8322 group in the middle which has 3 H atoms each on the neighbouring atoms. For quartet, n would be 3.
explanations.c: The splitting pattern depends on the number of protons on the neighbouring atom (n) using the formula (n+1). Methylene protons in propane belongs to CH&#8322 group in the middle which has 3 H atoms each on the neighbouring atoms. For doublet, n would be 1.
explanations.d: The splitting pattern depends on the number of protons on the neighbouring atom (n) using the formula (n+1). Methylene protons in propane belongs to CH&#8322 group in the middle which has 3 H atoms each on the neighbouring atoms. For septet, n would be 6.

questions.question: 3. How many different H environments for the molecule are shown?

explanations.c: The ratio of the different molecules depends on their numbers. Two CH&#8323 groups on C will have 6 equivalent protons, one CH&#8323 on carbonyl carbon will have one set of 3 equivalent protons, and one H in tertiary C (C-H) will a different proton. Hence the ratio (6.1.3).

questions.question: 4. What is the multiplicity of the hydrogen bonded to oxygen in an NMR spectrum of pure ethanol?

explanations.b: For triplet, n is 2. The neighbouring atom to Oxygen in ethanol is C which has 2 H atoms

questions.question: 5. Which of the following statements about the energy of an applied magnetic field is FALSE?

answers.a: This energy can “flip” a proton from alignment with the field to alignment opposite the field.
answers.b: Nuclei are “in resonance” when they absorb this energy.
answers.c: This energy is proportional to the magnetic field strength.
answers.d: This energy is supplied by radiation in the visible region of the spectrum.

explanations.a: Energy of the applied magnetic field is equivalent to the splitting of the spin states and when this much energy is supplied, the spin of the proton changes from along the field to opposite the field.
explanations.b: Nuclei are in resonance when they absorb radiowave frequency and undergo flip.
explanations.c: The energy difference of the two spin states depends on the strength of the magnetic field applied .
explanations.d: The radiation supplied to cause the flip is radiowave.
